website_summaries.verdict: A must-have for cat and dog owners who absolutely must let their pets out, even when there are too many blood-sucking mosquitoes outside.
pros: Gentle plant-based formula with geraniol oils and lemongrass
cons: Must be reapplied every 2 hours as needed

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT! The cat doesn't like it to be sprayed ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this on our family and our outside cat. Works GREAT! The cat doesn't like it to be sprayed on him though. I spray it on my hand and then rub it on his fur. We live in Florida and the mosquitos are terrible, for me to say this works... it works!
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: It smells good, and seems to repel mosquitos on both the ...
customer_reviews.text: It smells good, and seems to repel mosquitos on both the dog and me. I spritz a few sprays into my hands and rub it into my dog's coat. We live in coastal Florida, where our state bird seems to be the mosquito. While my dog is not a huge fan of the smell (he'd rather roll in poo, which he thinks smells "amazing"), it does seem to deter mosquitoes and biting flies.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a stray cat that was being constantly surrounded by mosquitoes, but she wouldn't let me get near her with it (even if I put it on my hands first). So I decided to try using it myself. I had a horrible horse fly problem in my yard. It works great at keeping horse flies and mosquitoes away! And it has a nice lemony smell instead of the harsh smell of regular bug spray.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: Although it's fairly early in the mosquito season, I wanted to get something to keep my puppy safe from the bugs. Each time I've used it he has played outside with (so far) no bugs! I am also using a flea and tick repellent in addition to the bug spray. Also, this spray smells great! It's a nice lemon grass scent and avoids that harsh smell of chemicals. I can't complain! :)
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Betcher

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of mosquitos in my area. We have a lot of mature trees and lots of bushes and plants everywhere. When I’m outside with my dogs I can literally see mosquitos swarming them especially around their stomachs, and once they are inside they won’t stop scratching and licking the bites. I am able to use off spray but obviously I can’t use that on my animals so I turned to this item. I really hoped this would help but i don’t see much of a difference. After spraying they still are surrounded and still get bit. Very sad. Maybe there’s just too many mosquitos to work? Not sure, but I’m disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Stick with off or another brand. Read reviews before purchase
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Maybe it's just Texas mosquitos but regardless, 5 minutes after spraying on. My dogs felt like a Chinese buffet. I tried it on myself coz it says for humans also, and nothing. The mosquitos were attacking me like an open bar at a wedding. With straws. And I bought 2 bottles
customer_reviews.author: Ponciano ibanez

customer_reviews.title: Itch free for summer pups
customer_reviews.text: Strong tea tree scent but I love it ! If you’re sensitive to smells this might give you a headache, but it works! I have 2 dogs a pit bull and a Boshi mix and they love the outdoors. I live in the humid south by 2 big oak trees and this keeps them nice and itch free! They don’t mind the smell and it does not irritate their skin.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Riley

customer_reviews.title: Smells good but only mildly repellent
customer_reviews.text: Not 100% effective, but I love the smell of this stuff. It’s like a citronella candle. I put it on myself also because it says you can do if you are comfortable smelling like a citronella candle then this might be for you. Also helps the pet smell a little fresher covering some of that stanky stank after being outside. Will still get some mosquitoes and any effect doesn’t last long. Sometimes bottles leak in shipping also but otherwise this stuff is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Works and does what it needs too.
customer_reviews.text: I keep it on the porch and spray my dog on his body and legs (never his face) just before I open the gate. We have major insects here and this helps keep them at bay. Non harmful, pleasant smelling, and safe. I just saw it is safe for humans too and considering its all natural that’s perfect. If you want to put it near or on your face I would spray it on the brim of a hat (that is what I do) or on a cloth towel and wipe it on but never spray directly on your face especially not near your eyes, mouth, nose. You don’t want to ingest it. That would be ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: lg212

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cats
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed it on my cat's ears in the morning. After she ate breakfast, she vomited it up. Later, the same with her dinner. This cat never vomits up her food -- and when I didn't put it on her ears after that one time, she was fine. I don't think this is something anyone should try on their cats.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!! This season with so much rain in our area or backyard was unbearable for our dogs. Scent of product is pleasing not overwhelming. Worked well to keep bugs away from our dogs! Product arrived on time and as described
customer_reviews.author: Shel 241

customer_reviews.title: Great find!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! We take around 5 walks a day and the afternoons/night walks have been miserable. I spend more time swatting mosquitoes away from my dog than anything. We tested it at the worst possible time of day (dusk) and I didn’t see one mosquito near him!!! He hated me spraying it on him but oh man am I happy! Smell is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Briana M

customer_reviews.title: Tested in the Jungle
customer_reviews.text: Always looking for a non-deet option, I bought this product, even though I knew that the materials in it were ineffective in the past. Unfortunately, things haven’t changed. I live in the Northeast and I travel, spending much time in the tropics with my dog. This mosquito spray smells nice and is easy to apply, but didn’t stop mosquito from landing on my dog. I wanted to make sure of the experiment, so I sprayed my bare legs and walked in the twilight and yes my legs were covered by mosquitoes. Maybe this is an effective product somewhere in the world, but not in the temperate or equatorial climates that I spent most of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Goal D

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t holding my breath that this would work but I needed to try something because the bugs are eating my dog up outside! I hate seeing them bother her so I gave this a try. I really feel like It made a difference. She doesn’t love having it sprayed on but she tolerates it and it doesn’t seem to agitate her sensitive skin. I spray some on my hands and rub the top of her head to make sure she is covered. I noticed a decrease in all her twitching and swatting at the mosquitos.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Delgadillo

customer_reviews.title: Great bug spray for cats
customer_reviews.text: I have outside cats who in the texas summer heat get mosquitos hovering them. I just spray this above them and let it fall onto them so they don’t freak out at getting sprayed with something. It definitely helps get rid of the mosquitos. I have even sprayed directly onto outside chairs and that has seemed to keep mosquitos away too. Not sure if this is recommended but to me it smells better than human bug spray so I have sprayed onto my ankles when working in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: blayne

customer_reviews.title: makes animal fur soft and shiny
customer_reviews.text: this product has a nice natural smell. i live in california and the mosquitos like to come out pretty early (around march) kitty doesn’t like to be sprayed so i just spray some on my hands and pet him down with it. it makes his fur nice and smooth and shiny, like conditioner lol! he likes to play outside a lot so i figured he should be protected from mosquitos (even though he likes to trap them and eat them lol) the smell is hard to get off of your hands though. i also use it on my labrador retriever who doesn’t mind being sprayed :)
customer_reviews.author: mars

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY TOXIC TO DOGS AND CATS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not realizing that the main ingredient is lemongrass oil, which according to ASPCA is highly toxic to both dogs and cats. The product also came shipped in a bag, resulting in the bottle being damaged and half the spray leaking out (not that i intended on using it anyways)
customer_reviews.author: Peyton Brusseau

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Last year my dog kept scratching around spring time. I assumed it was seasonal allergies and went to the vet and I was right. But for some reason it kept getting worse. Until I saw his skin had mosquito bites. This year I bought this and it's amazing. I spray a little on him before we go to the park and a little on his bed before bedtime. I love the smell and my dog doesn't mind it. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my boy!
customer_reviews.text: My corgi walks in the woods everyday, he's quite the rugged pup and we need to protect him from ticks and mosquitoes especially this summer we had a triple e outbreak, which dogs are effected by as well as people. So we invested in his own spray, which smells very nice and kept the bugs at bay, sometimes we would use this ourselves and seemed to keep the bugs away. My pup did not have one tick on him all summer long, so this helped him in that domain as well. I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: ScoutZzzs

customer_reviews.title: Not too repellant
customer_reviews.text: I applied this on both my dogs as well as on me. I went out to work on my yard aware that we have giant bitting mosquitos. I have to say it kept them off for a very short time. I finally had to apply OFF repellent instead to really keep them off.. and put my dogs back inside the house.instead.
customer_reviews.author: Macy

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I was skeptical at first but I'm a believer. This mosquito repellent for pets work very well. It's very hot and humid in South Florida and mosquitoes reign during the summer. I place my hand over their eyes, I spray around my dogs face, around their muzzle, on their foreheads, and under the chin. It works very well. They're not too thrilled about it but it's works. It's all natural, or you can use it on myself.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: No more bites
customer_reviews.text: My poor kitty's ears were getting all bit and she kept scratching them. Use this 3x and no more bites. Just be aware they have a very strong citrus odor which may bother some cats. I spray it twice on to a napkin and then wipe it on her ears and head.
customer_reviews.author: Ran-D

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant Smelling, Natural,  Plant- based “Vet’s Best” Spray Might Really Work Against Mosquitos!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this spray because one of my two cats gets mosquito bittten on her face every year, while here brother is unaffected. Though she hates being sprayed before going out, she has had no bad reaction to the spray. It is a natural, plant based formula that smells like citronella candles. Hard to tell yet if it is helping her. Need a few more weeks. But she is tolerating it well.
customer_reviews.author: redjug

customer_reviews.title: Caused eye infections on my dog
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this mosquito repellent my dog developed an eye infection the next day. I thought it had been something else and I took him to the vet. They couldn’t find what caused it so I moved on. I used it again yesterday and this morning his eyes were over producing gooey eye boogers. Thankfully I still have the treatment to cure it. I won’t be using this product again. Attached the medicine that cured the infection
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: It does work. But-
customer_reviews.text: This product really does help, I even used it on myself and it worked great. The issue is most dogs do not like getting sprayed.. mine have gotten to the point where they see this bottle and RUN! Be very careful to not get it in their eyes, mouth, and nose. This is challenging, especially because the mosquitos favorite place to bite my hound is right on the bridge of his nose. If they made this in a roller, that would be awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: False advertising! Only sprays upright
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say whether or not the spray actually works, the scent is quite strong but nice. The reason for the low rating is because one of the selling points of this for me was that it was clearly marked that it would spray upside down and at any angle. This is NOT true! As soon as I turn the bottle to spray my pups legs and belly it stops pumping. I have to spray it completely upright. I have to spray it on my hands to rub on her belly, legs and chest. Very inconvenient to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helps my neurotic cat
customer_reviews.text: She's not a huge fan, but she accepts it on evenings when the mosquitoes are out. She already has a tendency to pick and groom herself raw. Honestly I haven't figured out if she controls herself better because she has fewer bites, or because she doesn't like the taste. Anyway it works -- and we're both happier.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Bug spray for your pup
customer_reviews.text: Black fly season just passed us. I bought this because I was sitting in screen house with my dog and I noticed the black flies were bothering him I went looking for a bug spray that I could use on him. It seems to help and work well, of course my husky rolls around for about 20 minutes because he loves the scent....LOL... my crazy boy
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Lid came loose and leaked in package
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to work well enough, the smell is strong but effective. My main issue is that the lid was not tightly secured on the bottle and the product leaked out all over its packaging during shipping. This made for a smelly package and immediate cleanup upon delivery. Luckily I don't seem to have lost too much product, just a minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: SEEMS TO WORK AND DOG DOESN'T MIND IT AT ALL.
customer_reviews.text: I use this at dusk and at dawn. My dog is an in-and-out dog (doggie door) so she's not outside all of the time. I love it because it has natural ingredients. I don't use pesticides on her anymore so I also use the flea and tick repellant from Vets Best as well. Both products are great
customer_reviews.author: J. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Nice scent
customer_reviews.text: My dog is afraid of the spray and wiggles away as I'm trying to put it on. While I am unsure if it keeps mosquitoes away, my dog isn't scratching and I don't see bites on her legs or ears. It did NOT keep the biting flies off of her, but again, she didn't seem too bothered by them, so maybe it means they didn't bite. Smells nice and fresh. Give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: KSchaut

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this mosquito spray. It smells very strongly of lemongrass (in a good way) & my dog *hates* being sprayed but has no allergic reaction to this (which is huge because she is allergic to grass and basically everything!). I use it on myself because it smells better than Off and works just as well!
customer_reviews.author: Camie

customer_reviews.title: Bottle wasn't sealed so everything leaked out :(
customer_reviews.text: I don't like be "that guy" but I recieved my order today, it was delievered very quick, but when I opened my package, the bottles lid wasn't on correct so literally the bag the product was in and my Amazon bag were dripping wet. The ENTIRE bottle spilled out! There is nothing left in my bottle but a few drips. The smell is great (smells like citronella) but now I have no spray for my dogs and I'm going camping this weekend. I wanted to contact the seller but there is no option to do so, so unfortunately this is what i have to do. Im sure it would be a great product if it was actually sealed right.
customer_reviews.author: Briana J.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty effective 👍
customer_reviews.text: This product smells great to me! My dogs resists at first when I try to put it on him but soon forgets about it when we go outside to play. I definitely notice that he gets less bug bites. I wouldn't say it works as well as a DEET mosquito repellent (which I would never put on my dog), but it's the next best thing.
customer_reviews.author: Baylan  T

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t seen a mosquito
customer_reviews.text: I put this all over my dog when we go for a walk in the evening and the mosquitoes never bother her or me. This is the best stuff ever and not sticky. That’s what’s makes its so great is because its not stcky. Most mosquitoes sprays don’t work and there sticky.so thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your animals!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our lab when we are outdoors as the gnats have been horrendous this year. We dont feel it works for the gnats as well as everything else but it does help. It doesnt leave him greasy or gross. It smells good and not to strong or anything. And he doesnt seem to mind it either.
customer_reviews.author: rachael  miedema

customer_reviews.title: Seems Scammy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered twice, different packaging. Brown bottle was first order about a month ago. Today I got the same product from same seller (selected “order again”) and got a slightly larger white bottle. Both say 8 Oz. Also, it looks like it expired a month ago. I looked at the first (brown) bottle and it had expired when I got it the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Sara L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work!
customer_reviews.text: The mosquitoes just love to chew my elderly cat's ears and nose. When I give her a light spray down her back they appear to leave her alone.
customer_reviews.author: D. K.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS VERY WELL ON HUMAN AND ANIMALS
customer_reviews.text: I give this product an A+!!! Recently went camping in a state forest with my two teddy bear dogs. I purchase this item as it was stated safe on pets. There was a lot of horse and deer flies and mosquitos in the forest of course. This product not only kept them off my pups, it also kept them off me and my husband. :) No Deet required. Also no smell of bug spray. I recommend this product for sure and will buy again. Bravo!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kira & Grant

customer_reviews.title: Smells like Citronella and Lemon
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that I cannot and will not use it because it is expired and I do not want to put expired products on my furbaby. I ordered on 7/14/20 and the expiration is 7/8/20. The smell consists mainly of lemon and citronella.
customer_reviews.author: Jo'Nessa-Li'

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The place we live had a lot of mosquitos at one point and we needed something to protect our dog. This worked perfect for us and it does not smell too bad. We primarily used it when he was going on walks with us. Will buy again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram

customer_reviews.title: Smells great
customer_reviews.text: Smells great but the Alaskan mosquitoes think so too. Doesn't appear to repel any bugs--but like I said it make my dog smell nice.
customer_reviews.author: EZ

customer_reviews.title: Overwhelming smell
customer_reviews.text: Scent is very strong even the dog tried to get it off by rolling in the grass (made our people eyes burn and water and irritated our throat) I'll never be able to see if it really works because I'm never using it again
customer_reviews.author: D.A.K

customer_reviews.title: Too strong scent, doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I applied this repellent on my dog and it didn't work, she has so many bites from ants and other insects. My dog just hated this product, for dogs, it is a too strong scent and not strong enough for the insects.
customer_reviews.author: Helens

customer_reviews.title: Get For Some Relief
customer_reviews.text: I've already purchased this 4 different times for my two dogs at home. We live fairly close to a river and whenever were outside were constantly getting bit by those annoying things! I spray the dogs (be generous!) before we go out and this makes a noticeable difference and the dogs finally have some relief. Used it on myself before too. It's a great product definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ants

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Recently went to an area for K9 training and the mosquitoes were terrible. I used this on my dog and none bothered her. The whole K9 team ended up using it on their dogs after I raved about it to them.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: The [ankle biter mosquito] made it to our area last summer and they are vicious. If one sneaks in the house you will wake up with bites. I spray myself before retiring and no more waking up all bit up.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great repel
customer_reviews.text: My dogs usually are very sensitive to smell but this something they don’t mind. They actually like getting spray with this product. This product smells very good. Recommend ! my puppy hasn't had any mosquito bites since I started spraying her with this product when I take her on walks or in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: TheDop3stLopez

customer_reviews.title: Great scent
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used twice. Seem to work well. I haven’t sat and watched to see if mosquitoes still try to bite. Love the lemon smell. Dogs don’t mind being sprayed. It’s a pump spray. For the price I’m happy just knowing they have something on them.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki M

customer_reviews.title: I use it on myself
customer_reviews.text: The [ankle biter mosquitos] made it to our area last summer and they are vicious. If one sneaks in the house you will wake up with bites. I spray myself before retiring and no more waking up all bit up.
customer_reviews.author: S.R.L.

customer_reviews.title: NO DOGGIE BUG BITES
customer_reviews.text: SO HAPPY TO SAY THIS WORKED GREAT FOR MY TWO 4 YEAR OLD PITBULLS WHEN WE WENT CAMPING! JUST A FEW MISTS ALL OVER THEIR BODY & NOT ONE BUG BITE. MY DOGS ARE MOSQUITO MAGNETS!

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works :-)
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Mosquitos hover around the dogs but don’t seem to land and bite. Smells nice and I use it too ! Only 3 stars on ease to use - the spraying is not 360 / upside down as indicated. Is 100% better with bottle up. Could be a bad sprayer. Will certainly buy again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Vets Best is the best
customer_reviews.text: This works great to help pets get mosquitos off them, especially being here in Florida. I spray it on a cloth then wipe it on my cat. All vets best products really do seem to be the best.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love the smell! Seems to work pretty good, even for humans.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my lab due to the mosquitoes being really bad in my area. It seems to work pretty well, even used it on myself. Some of the reviews say the smell is awful, but personally I think it smells good. Just depends on your preference I guess lol.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Boutte

customer_reviews.title: Cat mosquitoes drama
customer_reviews.text: The repellent works well if you can manage to spray a lot of it on your kitty. Do not spray it on the face. We use a paper towel to rub on legs and belly. It smells delicious, We even use on ourselves. The down side is that doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Works good and not harmful or toxic!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is picky about smells and felt this was to potent but I loved it- fresh, light, not a clinging scent. Felt great that I could use it, not only for my pup. It kept the mosquitoes and bees away at our last camp trip.
customer_reviews.author: Britton

customer_reviews.title: The mosquitoes are horrible this time of year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for our cat. We live on a lake and are surrounded by woods. The mosquitoes are horrible this time of year. His poor little ears were covered with bites. So far this product seems to be working well. Trying to spray him is almost impossible! I have been spraying the product into my hands and rubbing it onto his head and ears. Smells a lot better than I expected, almost like lemon pledge? Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I live the smell. My dogs on the other hand do not. Lasted maybe 20 mins tops before I had to put another application on them. 20 mins is better than nothing. Just wished they actually like the spray. I use other sprays on them for cleaning, so they are used to sprays. Just really didn't like the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Devolreven

customer_reviews.title: Unknown if it worked
customer_reviews.text: My cat did not like getting sprayed. He would run away before I could get a decent shot at him. It was a waste of my money. I don’t know if it worked or not.
customer_reviews.author: slim

customer_reviews.title: Product had no effect repelling Mosquito's
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to using a product without Deet. Applied product liberally after a good shaking, then walked out into a mosquito area, then was promptly attacked by mosquito's on the skin I had just applied this product. I observered absolutely NO mosquito repelling effect at all..!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed it on my dog, then watched three mosquitos land on her now wet coat. This might work in the 48,it’s a joke in Alaska.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryDude77

customer_reviews.title: Needs better packaging!
customer_reviews.text: I'll give the product 5 stars as I'm not allergic to it and it works. The bottle itself is another story. First one I bought stopped working within a few days. Second one is doing better but isn't going to last until it's empty. I will continue to buy it in spite of the bottle
customer_reviews.author: rootessa

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical scent
customer_reviews.text: There is a strong chemical citrus scent after applying this spray to my dog. It was almost too strong forty dog to be in the car with me. It was not a fun ride.
customer_reviews.author: C. Abe

customer_reviews.title: Best mosquito repellent for Dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This product has a great Citronella smell very pleasing. My dogs don't mind me spraying it on them. Worked great! Definitelyrepelled the mosquitos. Here in South Texas the mosquitos are bad so now we avoided about 30 to 40 bites while taking our pups out. My dogs didn't try to lick it off either. Very pet friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: My dog got used to it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog hated me for a few hours the first time I applied it to him. Tried it on myself, worked great. Tried it on the dog again, he didn't hate me. I think he was used to the odor from me. The product isn't advertised as repellent for gnats, but I found it worked for them also.
customer_reviews.author: Azure

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Not keeping mosquitoes from biting either my dog or myself. I would not recommend. I’m confused as to how it’s received such high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging for shipment
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to work well, my dog gets very swollen from any bug bites so this help at least minimize her getting bitten. My issue is that they shipped it in a plastic bag in case of leaks butter cap was not even close to tight on mine and the leaks escaped the bag anyways. Then the product cause ink to come off the bottle labels and get all over my hands and bag later on. Not happy with the quality of shipping but liking the actual product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Not the worse smell but not good either.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this in anticipation that the mosquitos would be as bad this year as past. So far this has not been the case my dog does not like it one bit I'm not a fan of it either. Like I said "Not the worse smell but not good either"! The times that I've used it it worked so if you can deal with the smell it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Photocop2011

customer_reviews.title: Three Cheers for Making a Mosquito Repellent for Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to protect your pup from mosquitos! My puppy is afraid of sprays, so I spray it on a new pair of kitchen cleaning gloves I bought for her and rub her down good! You can also just use your hands because it is safe for humans to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff!! My dog doesn't care to much for the smell but doesn't mind being most with it. I use it for myself now lol it's works better than regular bug spray!
customer_reviews.author: Lexilex

customer_reviews.title: Very effective product!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! I have a diabetic dog who seems to attract mosquitos, and the spray really helps fend them off. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Cinny

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not good for multiple cats?
customer_reviews.text: We used some of this on both our cats and I think they licked it off of each other because these normally healthy cats threw up a bunch that weekend. The scent was alright but they did still smell like the repellent for a couple weeks afterwards... can't tell if it was effective in repelling mosquitos honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Grace C.

customer_reviews.title: lingering smell, more itching.
customer_reviews.text: After putting this on our dog, we noticed how strong the smell was. It was heavy, and it lingered very strongly. Hours after putting it on, we also noticed our dog itching much more than he had been in the previous days. We decided to give him a bath to wash it off because we could still smell it, and had to rinse him about 3 times with Dawn Soap for the smell to dull. Even then, the smell lingers.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Smells great but my dog HATED it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what happened, but as soon as I sprayed a little spritz on my dog HE WENT CRAZY. He did not like the smell or the feeling of it, I'm not entirely sure but he hated it so much. The smell is a pleasant lemony scent so it really did not bother me but he hated it. I'm sure this is a great product, however for my Shiba Inu it was NOT the one.
customer_reviews.author: Sammmy

customer_reviews.title: Bear approved, happy catdads
customer_reviews.text: bear loves hangin out in the yard but the dads worried about those nasty mosquito's. lovely lemongrass scent, light misting spray, happy bite free kitty
customer_reviews.author: Justin Carper

customer_reviews.title: Useless waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all! Both my dog and myself still had dozens of new bites after using this product. It had no effect whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if its helpful with the mosquitoes but it smells nice and the dogs don't seem to mind it. I have noticed not so much skin irritation on my dogs which I had assumed was due to mosquitoes. Product arrived on time and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't stand the scent
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this item worked or not. I used it once on my dog and the citronella scent was so strong I couldn't stand it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Leaking liquid
customer_reviews.text: The spray pump was not securely screwed on to the bottle and the liquid leaked out into the plastic bag. I'm glad that they put the bottle in a plastic bag, as it kept the liquid from leaking onto the other item in my order. I got an empty bottle!!! So sad!
customer_reviews.author: XinWenZhang

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful spray
customer_reviews.text: This product help me so much that I didn’t have to worry about my dog getting bitten by mosquitoes while on a hike in Tennessee I love the durability, i love the scent but most of all I love that it worked on my dog
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline zelaya

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it because the smell was great and strong my dogs smelled great and anywhere I spray it musiqutos would be gone
customer_reviews.author: Carlos M

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work for mosquitos, but not as well for sweat flies while we walked woodland trails.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover1013

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like that my dog and I can both use it and its safe. I have to say the scent is a little strong. Really helps keep the mosquitos away.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Expired
customer_reviews.text: I received this August 18 and I just pulled it out to use it and it says it expired 7/8/20.
customer_reviews.author: Morganmime

customer_reviews.title: many warnings to make sure people do not get on skin etc.
customer_reviews.text: did not do a thing to keep mosquitos off cat, nor did it work on long pant legs, and too many warnings for people to not have contact with it. If it is that bad for people, I dont really want it on my pet.
customer_reviews.author: lora brown

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for camping with the dogs. Works well. Just rub it into their fur a little.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie R

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product
customer_reviews.text: The product does very well with one of my dogs, who's pretty sensitive to mosquito bites. The only problem is that I have to spray her every time she goes out, which she goes outside pretty frequently throughout the day. My other dog is just scared of it and won't go outside because she knows she'll get sprayed. Also if you miss any spots, then it's over.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Shipments were expired TWICE.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived expired twice. Smell is very strong, puppy did not like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: I got to repel mosquitoes. It work for the first hour. Then had to reapply. I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: donald smith

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! My poor pup was getting eaten alive every time she went in my Woodsy backyard. This stuff has saved the day! She doesn’t mind it either.
customer_reviews.author: MKB

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We have received a lot of rain recently, and with rain, comes mosquitoes. When I took my little girl out for our morning walk, they would fly all around her. After I sprayed her with this product, there were absolutely no mosquitoes. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those extra big bugs
customer_reviews.text: My dog seemed to not be bothered as much by the cat sized blood sucking parasites in my backyard
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff here
customer_reviews.text: Smells good, I use it on my entire family, including the dog and we are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Loui

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my large dog. Keeps flies and mosquitoes at away, lovely scent. The dog appreciates being sprayed.
customer_reviews.author: BoDiLac

customer_reviews.title: Great for hairless dogs
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my hairless dog. I have no complaints and feel like it works well.
customer_reviews.author: bargaining_brunette

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. Cheap bottle.
customer_reviews.text: I use this at the park which my pup gets bitten by gnats badly and this stuff helped pretty well but the reason it gets three stars it because the bottle is cheaply made... I bought two of them, one to keep in my car and one to keep at one. One of them broke and wont spray anymore, the other is working okay but doesnt spray that well and gets all over my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Rather disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It only lasts for a night and only works a little. The smell is very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Coone

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: My one cat wants to immediately lick it off, but it keeps the mosquitoes off of both of them
customer_reviews.author: Lilspikey333

customer_reviews.title: Works okay for 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: Works okay for 2 hours. Keep it handy if your out any longer.
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Waite

customer_reviews.title: Works great at keeping dogs protected
customer_reviews.text: This is working awesome, smells good to , most importantly its keeping the little pest off my furry kids. An its made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Swedish/Irish /American

product_meta.title: Vet's Best Mosquito Repellent Spray for Dogs & Cats
product_meta.description: Size:8 ozVet's Best Mosquito repellent spray (8 oz) uses a unique blend of lemongrass Oil and geraniol oil (from Citronella plants) to safely repel mosquitoes. Formula is DEET free. Our formulas are independently tested and proven effective at repelling mosquitoes. Can be used directly on dogs and cats 12 weeks or older and people 2 years or older. For over 30 years, Vet’s best has blended plant-based ingredients that work together to comfort and protect your pet. Our products are a plant-based alternative to traditional chemicals and can be used year-round. They're also manufactured in the USA. For added mosquito protection, try Vet's Best flea and tick yard & kennel spray that kills mosquitoes in outdoor spaces.
feature_bullets: Vet's Best Mosquito repellent repels mosquitoes without the use of DEET.
Uses Plant-based ingredients including Certified natural essential oils like lemongrass oil and geraniol (from citronella Plants).
Proven effective and Manufactured in the USA.
Can be used on dogs and cats 12 weeks or older.
Can be reapplied every 2 hours as needed.
